It's his business to embalm you when the time comes
This word for a perfect world comes from a 1516 book
German prefix for "beyond", "over" or "super"
The classic board game Clue features this professor
Steve Breen wrote a kids' book rhymingly titled this girl "the Pilot"
The name of this purple birthstone comes from the Greek for "not intoxicated"
A Whitman poem begins, "When" these "last in the dooryard bloom'd"
Eggplant also goes by this French name

rounds.category: ONE OF THESE KINGS IS NOT LIKE THE OTHERS
rounds.comments: (Alex: ...because he rules a country that is different from the other two.)

When buying a digital camera, check the optical zoom number, an indicator of the quality of this part
Problems with video cards?  Make sure you've got the latest of these, often with the extension .drv
For TVs, 1080 is a measurement of this; it may be followed by "i" or by "p", which is preferred but probably pricier
Want to watch your TV when you're not home?  Get this "box", like the Solo, & make sure you have broadband access
This Apple Leopard application helps you find deleted documents & restore them, but watch out for the Morlocks!
The "Freeway Series" pits these 2 West Coast baseball teams against each other
"The World's Largest Outdoor Cocktail Party" is the football game between Georgia & the U. of this neighboring state
Played in this U.K. country, the Premier League rivalry between Celtic & the Rangers is called "the Old Firm"
Writer Steve Rushin said the hockey rivalry between Boston U. & this school was the biggest in all of sports
When playing against hated North Carolina in NCAA hoops, the Cameron Crazies of this school get loud
In compound words, this body part precedes print & tack
Spelled one way it's a small, official seal for documents; spelled another, it's a young swan
Merriam-Webster's New Words of 2007 included this one for a soap opera south of the border
From the Latin for "former", this word meaning pure & untouched is often used to describe a mountain or lake
To improve or perfect, it also means to sharpen on a whetstone
Hen Ben Haim is accused of running more than 500 fraudulent auctions on this website
Wanted for bank robbery, brown-eyed Jonathan Davis goes by the last name of this man, "Ol' Blue Eyes"
His FBI listing says he's wanted for 1998 bombings of U.S. embassies & is "a suspect in other terrorist attacks"
The FBI wants Glen Stewart Godwin for both murder & a 1987 escape from this Calif. prison where Johnny Cash had the "Blues"
The FBI wants this African country's Odowa Okuomose for bilking victims who were told they had to pay fees to claim big prizes
In Matthew chapter 3, he preached, "Repent ye: for the kingdom of heaven is at hand"
This stormin' Norman spent more than a third of his English reign out of the country & in fact died in Rouen in 1087
Obama told this Ohio blue-collar guy spreading the wealth was good; he became part of the McCain campaign
This spokesbovine for Borden began extolling the virtues of milk back in the 1930s
In "Portrait of a Killer", Patricia Cornwell contends that this killer was actor & artist Walter Sickert
Used since the 13th century, St. Gotthard pass in Switzerland is in these mountains
This strategically important pass lies on the border of Pakistan & Afghanistan
The Uspallata Pass in these mountains is home to a giant bronze statue of Christ
Daniel Boone led settlers into Kentucky through this pass that wasn't discovered by white Americans until 1750
clues.response: the Cumberland Gap (the Cumberland Pass accepted)

clues.text: Accessible in winter only by snowmobiles, the Charlotte Pass is found in this country's Snowy Mountains
An adjective for long, disheveled hair, or Scooby Doo's best buddy
To wrangle with a merchant over the price of an item
All your suitcases, or all your repressed psychological issues
The act of making something out to be more important than it really is
A proud, stiff, pompous gait
A few years after serving as a captain in the Franco-Prussian War, he painted "Dancer with a Fan"
Camille Pissarro called this U.S.-born painter of "Arrangements" the only artist "of whom America can be justly proud"
The creator of Pointillism, he preferred the term Divisionism for the technique
Finding Impressionism her cup of tea, this American first exhibited with the group in 1879 with "The Cup of Tea"
Pierre-Auguste Renoir was born in this city known for its porcelain & even apprenticed as a china painter at age 13

rounds.text: 2 of only 3 women who have been inducted into the Television Academy Hall of Fame
rounds.response: (2 of) Lucille Ball, Carol Burnett & Mary Tyler Moore
